greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle generated by T(n,k) = Fibonacci(n-k+2)^k.
comment: Number of tilings of an nXk chessboard using monomers and dimers of a fixed orientation. This is easy to see because the board here consists of k independent strips of length n. - _Ralf Stephan_, May 22 2014
This triangle is related to the infinite Vandermonde matrix
The generating series of the columns can be expressed in terms of
reference: John Riordan, Generating functions for powers of Fibonacci numbers,
program: (MAGMA) [Fibonacci(n-k+2)^k: k in [0..n], n in [0..10]]; /* Alternatively: */ [[Fibonacci(n-k+2)^k: k in [0..n]]: n in [0..8]]; // Bruno Berselli, Mar 28 2012
results.author: _Emanuele Munarini_, Mar 20 2012
